review_title: Productive and fulfilling college teaching career
job_title: Professor of Sociology in Glendale, CA
pros: Watching college students grow along with sociological knowledge while applying it to their lives at the micro level and the macro. When they find their paths in society, they have the full-partnership with others at work, at home, and beyond.
cons: When some college students do not get their anticipated grades, they blame others. It would be much wiser and rational, if s/he exams herself or himself first to see whether there are ways to improve oneself. Life is not fair at all. Unfortunately, we reap what we sow.

review_title: Beware. Temp Jobs Do Not Become Permanent
pros: The people are wonderful to work with. They are professional, dedicated to the success of students, friendly, generous. GCC works hard to offer a quality education.
cons: The college saves money by hiring many temporary employees so that they don't have to pay benefits. When a temp maxes out their hours, they are laid off and replaced with another temp. This causes a lot of disruption for students and staff. There is constant re-training and students are always taking the brunt of the disruption.  It's a terrible practice and should not be allowed to continue.

pros: One of the best cadet training programs in the region compared to other colleges and universities. GCC Police Departments is all about community policing or a systematic partnership to support the educational mission of the institution, and problem-solving techniques, to proactively address the immediate conditions. You have the opportunity to continuously learn and earn certified certificates. Be prepared to put time outside of work.
cons: Employer will do there best to accommodate your school schedule however personal activities, holidays, and weekends are out. Requires discipline to balance work and school schedule. 20 hr minimum per week, plus on call time, plus mandatory monthly training sessions plus limited vacation time.

review_title: Petty politics by upper management ruins a good workplace environment.
pros: A beautiful campus with a thoughtful blend of 1930's architecture and modern buildings with a nod to the past, a family atmosphere (which is disappearing now), wonderful students.
cons: An inexperienced senior management who plays politics down to the lowest level instead of running the day-to-day business of the college makes this a less than ideal place to work.  Decisions often don't get made, and if they do, they are so late as to be meaningless.  Projects need to be done two and three times and much additional cost because senior management changes its mind several times.

job_title: Special Needs Assistant in Glendale, CA
pros: Staff is very kind and helpful if you need extra resources or recommendations. I started out tutoring and the head of the department was always looking for other opportunities for me.
cons: There's no training or clear explanation for helping someone whose needs are specific. I was assigned to a blind student but wasn't told what the scope of my position was supposed to be.

job_title: Adjunct Instructor in Los Angeles, CA
pros: Control over your curriculum, flexible schedule, and competent, caring staff. The student body that I have taught try hard (for the most part) and enjoy engaging in class discussions.
cons: Like the US/California education system in general, the pay is unfair considering the work load (only paid for class and office hours, but no prep or grading hours) and there are very few opportunities for advancement as there are limited staff positions.

pros: The instructors and program coordinator gave a lot of freedom when it came to when and how the courses where reviewed.  The position provides a good way to not forget the instructed material.
cons: The courses were very helpful for the students who attended them, but not enough students were aware of the opportunity.

pros: Sense of family remains, for the time being.
cons: Senior leadership is very inexperienced and manages by politics and little else.,
